title: How to get more than one correspondent to show in cards?
creator: jdhauck
content: I'm using cards view in threaded mode. When collapsed, the card shows only the name or email of the sender of the first message in the conversation. Is there a way of getting a list of all correspondents to show? Or at least, to show the sender of the last message? This is especially relevant in the case of email chains with multiple correspondents. Currently, whomever started the chain will always be the first message and hence the top-most card. When new people respond, it shows the thread as "unread", however, the name of whomever sent the new email remains hidden until I expand the thread. Is there any way to change that behavior?

title: Using Local Folder - sent messages are setted to be saved in Sent Folder, but not
creator: WalterTabax
content:
Hi. I use Thunderbird PortableApps, version 141.0, 6 email accounts, all configured to get via POP and send via SMTP.

That was configured each account has his tree folder. when I found the possibility of joining all the accounts in a local folder, I made this change.

After that, despite each account has it's settings to save copy into the Sent folder, all sent messages are listed into the main Received folder.

Strange behaviour. So, I create a filter action to move all emails from "me" to the sent folder.

Is this normal?

BY THE WAY - what is the easyiest way to create a clean Thunderbird instalation, and after this, import all emails, filters and account settings from the old installation to the new one? Do you have a step by step FAQ?

I appreciate any help.

title: Location for saving attachment changes
creator: jerry1
content:
As an editor I get a lot of emails with attachments, mainly text files (.txt) and images (.jpg). I save them in a folder structure year/issue, so 2025/001, etc.

When I have a bunch of emails and want to save the attachments, it seems Thunderbird does not remember the location I selected last. Only when I have two emails in a row with the same type of attachment (.txt) does it remember. But in many cases I have multiple attachments and select Save All, and then the location is often one level higher than the last folder and sometimes somewhere else, although likely a folder I have used before but longer ago.

What is the logic behind the folder selection when I select Save or Save All?

Thanks!

title: Strange duplicate file when copying Thunderbird prifile
creator: firefoxeric
content:
I'm trying to copy an older Thunderbird profile so i can add it to my Thunderbird installation on a new computer (where I already have a profile and a bunch of mail). When I copy it, near the end of the copy process I get this strange message: "Replace the file 'Inbox.msf"? An older file with the same name already exists in 'mail.cyberacc.net'.

Original file: 143.3 kB. Last modified 2014-08-22 12:57:00 Replace with 122.2 kB. Last modified 2014-08-23 23:08:25

Curiously, no accounts from mail.cyberacc.net show up in my accounts sidebar. Under 'Account Management' it shows as 'XMPP - nn@cyberacc.net'

How can two files with the same name but different dates exist in the profile? What should I do in response to this prompt? Cancel? Skip? Replace?

Thanks

Copying from Lenovo x120e running Fedora 24 and Thunderbird 52.2.1 (64bit) Want to add to Thunderbird 128.13.0esr (64-bit) on Dell XPS 9315 running Fedora 42 Workstation Edition

title: REMINDER PANEL - IMPROVE USABILITY
creator: miker206wa1
content:
Please reverse the REMINDER PANEL column order to Improve Usability:

NOW: "Event description" (_BIG_ whitespace) "Event Date Time"

SUGGEST: "Event Date Time" (small whitespace) "Event description"

WHY:

"Event Date Time" is fixed-length (short) "Event description" is variable-length (longer)

The suggested column order brings the "Event Date Time" closer to the "Event description" and INCREASES READABILITY.

Thank you, -Mike Ramey
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/139.0.0.0 Safari/537.36
